result.execSummary:
The defendant Leonardo Franco Isidoro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs shall be paid at the rate of $50/month commencing October 1, 2022 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leonardo Franco Isidoro

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leonardo Franco Isidoro in court.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter present and sworn.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def waives right to counsel; Court accepts.  Case to be recalled.
CASE RECALLED.  Pretrial held; agreement reached.  Def continues atty waiver; Court accepts.  Def enters guilty plea. Def acknowledges prior Operate w/out Valid DL citation.  Court finds def guilty and proceeds to sentencing.
Initial appearance on August 30, 2022 at 10:00 am - rescheduled as def requires interpreter; notice provided in person to def on 8-8-22
Initial appearance on August 8, 2022 at 09:45 am.
